intro: Monnina densecomata, commonly known as the densestem bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Monnina densecomata is often found in rocky soils and dry slopes, thriving in arid to semi-arid environments.
